title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Statistics (Income of Private Hospitals
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Statistics (Income of Private Hospitals 

Survey) Order 2021.
text_norm: 1 order may cited statistic (income private hospital survey) order 2021

title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: In this Order -
text_raw:
2. 

In this Order - 

“healthcare” means all activities with the primary purpose of improving, 
maintaining and preventing the deterioration of the health status of persons and 
mitigating the consequences of ill-health through the application of qualified 
health knowledge; 

“medical provider” includes - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

a registered medical practitioner within the meaning of the 
Medical Practitioners Act 2007 (No. 25 of 2007), 

a registered dentist within the meaning of the Dentists Act 1985 
(No. 9 of 1985), and 

a registered pharmacist within the meaning of the Pharmacy Act 
2007 (No. 20 of 2007); 

“private hospital” means a hospital (including an approved centre within the 
meaning of section 63 of the Mental Health Act 2001 (No. 25 of 2001)) which - 

(a) provides healthcare, and 

(b) 

is not a publicly-funded hospital, 

and includes a private hospital in respect of which arrangements have been, or 
may be, made for the provision of services at the hospital to public patients by 
agreement with the Health Service Executive; 

“publicly-funded hospital” means a hospital which provides services to a person 
pursuant to his or her entitlement under Chapter II of Part IV of the Health Act 
1970 (No. 1 of 1970); 

“public sources” includes - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the National Treatment Purchase Fund, 

the Health Service Executive, 

the Department of Health, 

1 OJ No. L 62, 6.3.2015, p. 6. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 28th December, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [705] 3 

(d) 

a Department of State (other than the Department of Health), and 

(e) 

a health authority of another state; 

“survey” means the Income of Private Hospitals Survey conducted by the 
Central Statistics Office for the purposes of obtaining from private hospitals the 
information specified in the Schedule.
text_norm: 2 order - healthcare mean activity primary purpose improving maintaining preventing deterioration health status person mitigating consequence ill-health application qualified health knowledge medical provider includes - (a) (b) (c) registered medical practitioner within meaning medical practitioner act 2007 (no 25 2007) registered dentist within meaning dentist act 1985 (no 9 1985) registered pharmacist within meaning pharmacy act 2007 (no 20 2007) private hospital mean hospital (including approved centre within meaning section 63 mental health act 2001 (no 25 2001)) - (a) provides healthcare (b) publicly-funded hospital includes private hospital respect arrangement may made provision service hospital public patient agreement health service executive publicly-funded hospital mean hospital provides service person pursuant entitlement chapter ii part iv health act 1970 (no 1 1970) public source includes - (a) (b) (c) national treatment purchase fund health service executive department health 1 oj no l 62 6.3.2015 p 6 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 28th december 2021 705 3 (d) department state (other department health) (e) health authority another state survey mean income private hospital survey conducted central statistic office purpose obtaining private hospital information specified schedule

title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: 3. This Order applies to a private hospital in the State.
text_raw: 3. This Order applies to a private hospital in the State.

title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: 4. A requirement on a private hospital to which this Order applies to
text_raw:
4. A requirement on a private hospital to which this Order applies to 
provide, once only and for the purposes of the survey, information the general 
nature of which is specified in the Schedule, is hereby prescribed.
text_norm: 4 requirement private hospital order applies provide purpose survey information general nature specified schedule hereby prescribed

title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: 5. The Statistics (Income of Private Hospitals) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 383 of
text_raw:
5. The Statistics (Income of Private Hospitals) Order 2014 (S.I. No. 383 of 

2014) is revoked. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [705]
text_norm: 5 statistic (income private hospitals) order 2014 (s.i no 383 2014) revoked 4 705

title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: Article 4

title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: In relation to each of the years 2019 and 2020, the detailed income and
text_raw:
1. 

In relation to each of the years 2019 and 2020, the detailed income and 
expenditure statements in accordance with a private hospital’s audited 
financial statements.
text_norm: 1 relation year 2019 2020 detailed income expenditure statement accordance private hospital audited financial statement

title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: In relation to each of the years 2019 and 2020, the following particulars in
text_norm: 2 relation year 2019 2020 following particular accordance private hospital audited financial statement (a) income public source (b) income private health insurer (c) income patient contribution (classified care type excluding income patient private health insurance) (d) income charitable source (e) (f) (g) income private source income bequest private donation income medical provider use private hospital facility (h) surplus income cost expenditure (i) income source

title: relation to paragraph 3 of the Schedule to the following order, for the purpose of
heading: Particulars of the time taken to complete the form, questionnaire or other
text_raw:
3. 

Particulars of the time taken to complete the form, questionnaire or other 
record prepared by the Director General for the collection of information 
referred to in paragraph 1 and 2. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 December, 2021. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach.
